ygData.subject: SV: Inspecting
ygData.msgSnippet: This is a no right no wrong discussion. If you want to sit there beeing upset about rude people checking your gear without asking, go ahead. If you want to
ygData.messageBody:
This is a no right no wrong discussion.

If you want to sit there beeing upset about rude people checking your gear
without asking, go ahead.

If you want to think "Yeah, nice, awsome, i really have some awsome stuff
since everyone checking out my tool", feel free.

As Lana so well pointed out, this is a personal issue, there ain't any rulez
about it.

As for me it doesn't matter if people say hello, hi or whatever. I will
still be watching my back for someone attacking me.

That's my 10 cents.

-Domi Fuling
Tallon Zek

-----Ursprungligt meddelande-----
Fr�n: Lanadina the Magician [mailto:lanadina@...]
Skickat: den 9 februari 2000 14:21
Till: EverQuest@onelist.com
�mne: Re: [EverQuest] Inspecting


From: "Lanadina the Magician" <lanadina@...>

Wizaro,

Like I said...its a personal issue for me. I think its just common courtesy
for someone to ASK before inspecting. Its called being polite. I never
inspect without asking, so I expect the same respect in return.

Lana


----Original Message Follows----
From: MFerrulo@...
Reply-To: EverQuest@onelist.com
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Inspecting
Date: Tue, 8 Feb 2000 19:01:23 EST

In a message dated 02/07/2000 1:58:41 PM Eastern Standard Time,
lanadina@... writes:

<<
hehee I thought I was the only one bothered by it. Yes...I find it rude if
people inspect and don't ask first. That is like some stranger coming to
my
door and walking in and checking out my CD Collection hehe
>>

How? I'm totally confused? Some starnger sees you on the street - he can
see
your Boots, your Cloak, your jewelry, your hat. Do you run away from
everyone who looks at you in the real world? Someone walking into my house
and checking out my CD collection would be rude as hell I agree, but in EQ
we
have no homes, so we keep all our possessions in the bank and in item slots
and containers. NO ONE CAN SEE THESE!!! As it should be. I am dumfounded
that people in EQ are upset that people can see what they have ON THIER
BODIES.

Wizaro Wrathcaster
